geneVariantDescriptions.description: HERPUD1-BRAF results from the fusion of HERPUD1 and BRAF (PMID: 25266736)), and has not been biochemically characterized, however, due to the effects of other BRAF fusions that result in loss of the BRAF CR1 domain and retention of the protein kinase domain (PMID: 23890088, PMID: 12781369), is predicted to result in a gain of function. HERPUD1-BRAF has been identified in pancreatic acinar cell adenocarcinoma (PMID: 28884748, PMID: 25266736).

references.title: Recurrent BRAF kinase fusions in melanocytic tumors offer an opportunity for targeted therapy.
Raf proteins and cancer: B-Raf is identified as a mutational target.
Comprehensive genomic profiling of pancreatic acinar cell carcinomas identifies recurrent RAF fusions and frequent inactivation of DNA repair genes.
A FISH assay efficiently screens for BRAF gene rearrangements in pancreatic acinar-type neoplasms.
